metadata.feature_description: Shows template status indicators like Hidden, Disabled, or Published

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Access Templates Page and View Status Indicators

steps.action: Logged into DNN as host user
steps.expected: Successful login and access to PersonaBar
steps.actual: Successfully logged in as SuperUser Account

steps.action: Navigated to Manage > Templates in PersonaBar
steps.expected: Page Templates panel opens with list of templates showing status indicators
steps.actual: Page Templates panel opened but templates list failed to load - shows empty state

steps.action: Clicked Add Template button to understand template requirements
steps.expected: Add template form or dialog appears
steps.actual: Message displayed: 'You must save an existing page as a template prior to create a new template'

steps.action: Attempted to save existing page as Evoq Page Template from Pages panel
steps.expected: Template created successfully and visible in Templates list with status
steps.actual: HTTP 500 server errors occurred - template creation failed. GetPageTemplates API consistently returns 500 Internal Server Error

issues: GetPageTemplates API returns HTTP 500 Internal Server Error
Cannot load existing templates due to server-side error
Cannot create new templates - save operation fails with 500 error
Error message displayed: 'There was an error retrieving your content. Please check your internet connection.'

observations: Code review confirms Template Status Display feature exists in Templates.html (line 82): status span with CSS binding shows 'visible' class when status is 'Hidden' or 'Disabled'
The status value comes from _pageManagementController.GetTabStatus(tab) in TemplatesController.cs (line 285)
Feature implementation appears complete in code, but server-side API errors prevent UI testing
The Templates module has persistent HTTP 500 errors when calling GetPageTemplates and related APIs
This appears to be a server configuration or database issue rather than a feature defect
